Thanks for your note of December l4th. You have not
fouled up the Herald Tribune Forum. You carried on
exactly as we wobld have wanted you to.
Insofar as the Mid-Century Speech Convention is concerned,
I had hoped that you would be able to be here to represent
MM* However, I think it more important to use the funds
for another meeting of the Board of Directors some time in
January or February. I do hope you will do everything
possible to get the KAEB brochure prepared as soon as
possible. Time is rapidly running oufc, and the membership
drive ought to get under way no later than the second week
in January.
I have went a supply of stationary to all Directors, and we
are forwarding the Office of Education list of Higher Education
Institutions to all Directors. I hope that you vdll ride herd
on this. A letter to each institution ought to go out from
each Director. You will necessarily have to distribute the
brochures and the membership blanks. I am sure that you can
get the printing done at your place, and I will be happy to
approve the bills.

The new fund raising campaign will get under way the first
week in January. We are now busily engaged in working out the
answers to some of the problems for General Taylor for the
January 15th hearings. I will try to keep you posted, although
things are moving very rapidly.
